abstract.p: don't blame egypt**Hussein Ibish letter replies to Thomas L Friedman's question (Aug 1 column) as to what United States is getting out of its relationship with Egypt, and Friedman's blaming Egyptian Pres Hosni Mubarak for failure of Camp David talks

block.p: Thomas L. Friedman (''The Egypt Game,'' column, Aug. 1) blames President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt for the supposed failure of the Camp David talks and asks, ''What exactly are we getting out of our relationship with Egypt -- not to mention $30 billion in aid to Egypt since 1978?''
In fact, the real question is, What exactly are we getting for the United States' deference to every Israeli whim and desire, and for the $88 billion in aid Israel has received from us since 1967?

Thomas L. Friedman (''The Egypt Game,'' column, Aug. 1) blames President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt for the supposed failure of the Camp David talks and asks, ''What exactly are we getting out of our relationship with Egypt -- not to mention $30 billion in aid to Egypt since 1978?''
In fact, the real question is, What exactly are we getting for the United States' deference to every Israeli whim and desire, and for the $88 billion in aid Israel has received from us since 1967?

The answer is refusal to fully withdraw from Palestinian and Syrian territory, disregard for United Nations resolutions, proliferation of nuclear weapons, aggression against its neighbors, damage to American relations with other Middle East countries and espionage against the United States.
The writer is communications director, American-Arab Anti-Discrimination Committee.
